availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Organized at Louisville, Jefferson County, Kentucky. Mustered in on October 6, 1863. Re-enlisted for three years in February 1864. Mustered out at Louisville, Jefferson County, Kentucky on August 1, 1865. Commander(s): Captain John J. Hawes, Captain Llewllyn E.P. Bush, Captain Samuel A. Miller.
One of the constituent batteries of the 1st Kentucky Light Artillery Regiment. Also known as the 5th Kentucky Battery.

ab.bibl:
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), p. 512, 521.
KYR-0001-003-0095.
